transparency.name: SHAP Values
transparency.description: SHapley Additive exPlanations - Unified approach to explain model predictions
transparency.interpretation: Higher absolute values indicate more important features. Positive values increase prediction, negative decrease it.

transparency.name: LIME Score
transparency.description: Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations for individual predictions
transparency.interpretation: Explains individual predictions by learning local interpretable models around predictions.

transparency.name: Feature Importance
transparency.description: Measures the contribution of each feature to model predictions
transparency.interpretation: Higher values indicate more important features for the model's decision-making process.

transparency.name: Permutation Importance
transparency.description: Measures feature importance by observing prediction changes when feature values are permuted
transparency.interpretation: Higher values indicate features that significantly impact model performance when removed.

fairness.name: Demographic Parity
fairness.description: Measures if positive prediction rates are equal across groups
fairness.interpretation: Values close to 0 indicate better demographic parity. Perfect parity = 0.

fairness.name: Equal Opportunity
fairness.description: Measures if true positive rates are equal across groups
fairness.interpretation: Values close to 0 indicate better equal opportunity. Perfect equality = 0.

fairness.name: Equalized Odds
fairness.description: Combines equal opportunity and equal false positive rates
fairness.formula: TPR and FPR equal across groups
fairness.interpretation: Both true positive and false positive rates should be equal across protected groups.

fairness.name: Calibration
fairness.description: Measures if predicted probabilities match actual outcomes across groups
fairness.interpretation: Well-calibrated models have predicted probabilities that match observed frequencies.

robustness.name: Adversarial Accuracy
robustness.interpretation: Higher values indicate better robustness to adversarial examples.

robustness.name: Certified Robustness
robustness.description: Provable bounds on model robustness within specified perturbation budgets
robustness.interpretation: Provides mathematical guarantees about model behavior under bounded perturbations.

robustness.name: Distribution Shift Detection
robustness.description: Measures model performance degradation under data distribution changes
robustness.interpretation: Lower degradation indicates better robustness to distribution shifts.

robustness.name: Input Gradient Norm
robustness.description: Measures sensitivity of model outputs to input changes
robustness.interpretation: Lower gradient norms indicate more stable and robust predictions.

accountability.name: Model Lineage Tracking
accountability.description: Comprehensive tracking of model development, training, and deployment history
accountability.interpretation: Complete lineage enables full accountability and reproducibility.

accountability.name: Audit Trail Completeness
accountability.description: Percentage of model decisions with complete audit trails
accountability.interpretation: Higher percentages indicate better accountability and traceability.

accountability.name: Compliance Score
accountability.description: Adherence to regulatory requirements and internal policies
accountability.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better compliance with governance frameworks.
